problem.question:
What is output by the code
to the right?
problem.code:
int[][] mat = {{2,7,5},
               {2,1,3},
               {8,4,2}};
int tot = 0;
for(int r = 0; r < mat.length; r++)
  for(int c = r; c < mat[0].length; c++)
    tot += mat[r][c];
System.out.print(tot);

problem.question: What is output by the code to the right?
problem.code:
int[][] mat1 = new int[4][4];
for(int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
  for(int j = 0; j < 4; j++)
    mat1[j][i] = i - j;

for(int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
  System.out.print( mat1[2][i]);

problem.d: There is no output due to a syntax error.
problem.e: There is no output due to an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

problem.question:
What replaces <*1> in the code
to the right to set the variable
cs equal to the number of 
columns in the two dimensional
array of ints named t?
problem.code:
public int handle(int[][] t){
  int tot = 0;
  int rs = t.length;
  int cs = <*1>;
  int start = Math.min(rs, cs) - 1;
  int m = start / 2;
  for(int i = start; i >= 0; i--){
    tot += t[i][m];
    tot += t[m][i];
  }
  return tot;
}

problem.question:
Assume <*1> is filled in correctly.

What is returned by method handle
if t is the matrix shown below?

 1   4   0   2   1   6
 0  -1   5   4   0  -4
 2   2   7   1  13   2
11   5  13  13   4  20
problem.code:
public int handle(int[][] t){
  int tot = 0;
  int rs = t.length;
  int cs = <*1>;
  int start = Math.min(rs, cs) - 1;
  int m = start / 2;
  for(int i = start; i >= 0; i--){
    tot += t[i][m];
    tot += t[m][i];
  }
  return tot;
}

problem.question: What is output by the code to the right?
problem.code:
int count = 2;
int[][] mat = new int[3][4];
for(int r = 0; r < mat.length; r++){
  for(int c = 0; c < mat[0].length; c++){
    mat[r][c] = count;
    count++;
  }
}

System.out.print(mat[2][2]);
